dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5172 IH: Strong Sentences for Safer D.C. Streets Act

action.action-desc: Mr. Biggs of Arizona (for himself and Mr. Donalds) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To increase the mandatory minimum sentences applicable to certain crimes in the District of Columbia, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Strong Sentences for Safer D.C. Streets Act.

section.header: Increase in mandatory minimum sentences for certain crimes in District of Columbia

paragraph.text: Section 801 of the Act to establish a code of law for the District of Columbia, approved March 3, 1901 (sec. 22–2104, D.C. Official Code) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking not less than 30 years and all that follows and inserting life imprisonment without release.; and

paragraph.header: Conforming amendment relating to sentencing procedure
paragraph.text: Section 801a of the Act to establish a code of law for the District of Columbia, approved March 3, 1901 (sec. 22–2104.01, D.C. Official Code) is repealed.

paragraph.header: Conforming amendment relating to conditions for imposition of sentence in excess of 60 years
paragraph.text: Section 3a(b–2)(1) of the Act to establish a Board of Indeterminate Sentence and Parole for the District of Columbia and to determine its functions, and for other purposes, approved July 15, 1932 (sec. 24–403.01(b–2)(1), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking in excess of 60 years for first degree murder or first degree murder while armed,.

subsection.text: Section 801(c) of the Act to establish a code of law for the District of Columbia, approved March 3, 1901 (sec. 22–2104(c), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking not more than life and inserting not less than 10 years or more than life.

subsection.header: Rape and first degree sexual abuse
subsection.text: Section 801a of the Act to establish a code of law for the District of Columbia, approved March 3, 1901 (sec. 22–2104.01, D.C. Official Code) is repealed.

paragraph.text: Section 3(b) of the Act to establish a Board of Indeterminate Sentence and Parole for the District of Columbia and to determine its functions, and for other purposes, approved July 15, 1932 (sec. 24–403(b), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking shall not be less than 7 years if the violation occurs after the person has been convicted in the District of Columbia or elsewhere of a crime of violence, as so defined and inserting shall be not less than 25 years or, if the violation occurs after the person has been convicted in the District of Columbia or elsewhere of a crime of violence, as so defined, shall be not less than 30 years.

paragraph.header: Mandatory minimum for first degree sexual abuse
paragraph.text: Section 201(a) of the Anti-Sexual Abuse Act of 1994 (sec. 22–3002(a), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking for any term of years or life and inserting for a term of not less than 25 years or more than life.

paragraph.header: Removal of requirement of aggravating circumstances for imposition of sentence in excess of 30 years
paragraph.text: Section 201(b) of the Anti-Sexual Abuse Act of 1994 (sec. 22–3002(b), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking The court may impose and inserting Except in the case of a sentence imposed under subsection (a) or imposed on a person convicted of rape pursuant to section 3(b) of the Act to establish a Board of Indeterminate Sentence and Parole for the District of Columbia and to determine its functions, and for other purposes, approved July 15, 1932, the court may impose.

subsection.text: Section 812 of the Act to establish a code of law for the District of Columbia, approved March 3, 1901 (sec. 22–2001, D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking not more than 30 years and inserting not less than 10 years or more than 30 years.

paragraph.text: Section 811a(a)(2) of the Act to establish a code of law for the District of Columbia, approved March 3, 1901 (sec. 22–2803(a)(2), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking not less than 7 years and inserting not less than 10 years.
Section 811a(b)(2) of such Act (sec. 22–2803(b)(2), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking not less than 15 years and inserting not less than 20 years.

subsection.text: Section 823(a) of the Act to establish a code of law for the District of Columbia, approved March 3, 1901 (sec. 22–801(a), D.C. Official Code) is amended by striking not less than 5 years and inserting not less than 10 years.

section.text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to individuals charged on or after the date of the enactment of this Act with an offense to which such an amendment applies.
